title: Sweet Potato and Spinach Curry with Cauliflower Rice

ingredients.content: 450 g cauliflower, cut in florets (3 cm), stalks removed
1 red chilli, or to taste, halved, deseeded if desired (optional)
600 g sweet potatoes, peeled, diced (3 cm)
½ tsp fine sea salt, or to taste
1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste

preparations.content: Place cauliflower in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>2 sec//speed 5<b>. Transfer to Varoma tray, leaving some holes unobstructed for steam to circulate, then set aside.
Place oil, onions, garlic and chilli (if using) in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>4 min/100°C/speed <b>.
Add cumin seeds and curry powder then sauté <b>2 min/100°C/speed <b>.
Add sweet potatoes, tomato purée, water and vegetable stock then cook <b>8 min/100°C//speed <b>.
Place covered Varoma into position and cook <b>8 min/Varoma//speed 0.5<b> until sweet potato is tender. Set covered Varoma aside.
Add spinach, salt and pepper then, place covered Varoma back into position and cook <b>2 min/Varoma//speed 0.5<b>. Serve curry hot with the cauliflower rice.
